snippet: In the parts of the nation where local governments’ capacity to respond to the devastation was greatly diminished, religious and community groups have vastly expanded their roles.
abstract: Churches, community groups and individuals have stepped in to perform relief work in areas of Philippines where local governments' capacity to respond to devastation of Typhoon Haiyan has been greatly diminished.

byline.original: By AUSTIN RAMZY and ANDREW JACOBS
byline.contributor: Austin Ramzy reported from Tacloban, and Andrew Jacobs from Guiuan, the Philippines. Robert Gonzaga contributed reporting from Tacloban.

lead_paragraph: In the parts of the nation where local governments’ capacity to respond to the devastation was greatly diminished, religious and community groups have vastly expanded their roles.

headline.main: Philippine Community Groups Fill Vacuum in Typhoon’s Aftermath
headline.print_headline: Philippine Community Groups Fill Vacuum in Typhoon’s Aftermath
